Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Would you like to join an international atmosphere and being involved in projects across Europe and with impact worldwide having the opportunity to consolidate your career? This is your opportunity!




We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team!




Data Scientist to support Advanced Analytics use cases in the area of aftersales products , with the end to end responsibility.




Understands data from a business and analytics point of view, finds out patterns and relationship in data, identifies methods for analysis and develops and performs data analysis.

Selects the appropriate tools, models, and methods for the data analysis.




Description of role and responsibilities:

Support the departments in the value creation and monetization of data-based solutions
Identify necessary data and are responsible for data collection and exploration, including data harmonization and preparation for internal and external partners
Identify and implement relevant use cases with customer added
Integrate analysis results and forecasts into relevant sales channels and applications
Work closely with the regional teams and support international rollouts of analytics solutions
Work with both external and internal teams to develop products




Education degree & experience

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Sc., Data Analytics or Information Technology. Bachelor in Engineering, Mathematics or a Quantitative Field.




Minimum 3 years’ experience in Data Science, Machine Learning Tools and Algorithms.




Technical experience




Proficiency in Spark/Pyspark.
Extensive experience working with modeling libraries like Tensorflow, Sklearn, Statsmodels, Pytorch.
Experience creating, deploying and maintaining ML models.
Experience building data pipelines.
Proficiency in Python, SQL & Basic Unix Commands.
Experience with data visualization tools like Plotly, PowerBI, Tableau and others.
Experience with Model Explainability tools.
Profound experience in Databricks.
Experience in CI/CD
Kubernetes experience is valued.




Cloud Technologies

Experience developing and deploying solutions in Azure (Azure ML, VM ,Functions ,Storage, DevOps, etc.)
Experience in AWS (Lambdas, S3, EC2, Sagemaker) is highly valued.




Methodologies, Techniques & Others

Experience in Agile and Scrum.
High coding standards are also required.
Kanban, Scrumban or SAFe Experience is valued.




Business skills:

Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills.
Good written and oral communication skills.
Results-oriented, self-directed ability to drive change in an unstructured environment.
Time management skills.
International experience and multicultural skills are highly valued




English

Proficient in English, both written and spoken.
Knowledge of the German language is a plus.




Other Preferences

In addition to technical expertise, the ideal candidate should possess a set of vital soft skills for the role, including agility to swiftly adapt to evolving situations, a strong sense of empowerment, fostering trust and inspiration, a co-creative mindset that thrives on collaborative innovation, a relentless drive to excel and achieve success, unwavering customer orientation aimed at continually delighting our clients, a deep-rooted sense of purpose, a pioneering spirit that embraces innovation, and a commitment to continuous learning to stay at the forefront of industry advancements. All these skills are included as People Principles in the Mercedes-Benz career path for our continuous development.




We offer you the opportunity to grow in an international and dynamic environment, taking part in new projects.




Within our benefits as employee, we provide:

Competitive salary + variable compensation
60% Mobile work
Flexible entering hours
30 working days of holidays
Annual Training Plan
Mercedes-Benz benefits (Renting plans, employee discount)
Show more
HTML:
Would you like to join an international atmosphere and being involved in projects across Europe and with impact worldwide having the opportunity to consolidate your career? This is your opportunity!


We are looking for a Data Scientist to join our team!


Data Scientist to support Advanced Analytics use cases in the area of aftersales products , with the end to end responsibility.


Understands data from a business and analytics point of view, finds out patterns and relationship in data, identifies methods for analysis and develops and performs data analysis.

Selects the appropriate tools, models, and methods for the data analysis.


Description of role and responsibilities:

  • Support the departments in the value creation and monetization of data-based solutions
  • Identify necessary data and are responsible for data collection and exploration, including data harmonization and preparation for internal and external partners
  • Identify and implement relevant use cases with customer added
  • Integrate analysis results and forecasts into relevant sales channels and applications
  • Work closely with the regional teams and support international rollouts of analytics solutions
  • Work with both external and internal teams to develop products


Education degree & experience

Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Sc., Data Analytics or Information Technology. Bachelor in Engineering, Mathematics or a Quantitative Field.


Minimum 3 years’ experience in Data Science, Machine Learning Tools and Algorithms.


Technical experience


  • Proficiency in Spark/Pyspark.
  • Extensive experience working with modeling libraries like Tensorflow, Sklearn, Statsmodels, Pytorch.
  • Experience creating, deploying and maintaining ML models.
  • Experience building data pipelines.
  • Proficiency in Python, SQL & Basic Unix Commands.
  • Experience with data visualization tools like Plotly, PowerBI, Tableau and others.
  • Experience with Model Explainability tools.
  • Profound experience in Databricks.
  • Experience in CI/CD
  • Kubernetes experience is valued.


Cloud Technologies

  • Experience developing and deploying solutions in Azure (Azure ML, VM ,Functions ,Storage, DevOps, etc.)
  • Experience in AWS (Lambdas, S3, EC2, Sagemaker) is highly valued.


Methodologies, Techniques & Others

  • Experience in Agile and Scrum.
  • High coding standards are also required.
  • Kanban, Scrumban or SAFe Experience is valued.


Business skills:

  • Strong critical thinking and problem solving skills.
  • Good written and oral communication skills.
  • Results-oriented, self-directed ability to drive change in an unstructured environment.
  • Time management skills.
  • International experience and multicultural skills are highly valued


English

  • Proficient in English, both written and spoken.
  • Knowledge of the German language is a plus.


Other Preferences

In addition to technical expertise, the ideal candidate should possess a set of vital soft skills for the role, including agility to swiftly adapt to evolving situations, a strong sense of empowerment, fostering trust and inspiration, a co-creative mindset that thrives on collaborative innovation, a relentless drive to excel and achieve success, unwavering customer orientation aimed at continually delighting our clients, a deep-rooted sense of purpose, a pioneering spirit that embraces innovation, and a commitment to continuous learning to stay at the forefront of industry advancements. All these skills are included as People Principles in the Mercedes-Benz career path for our continuous development.


We offer you the opportunity to grow in an international and dynamic environment, taking part in new projects.


Within our benefits as employee, we provide:

  • Competitive salary + variable compensation
  • 60% Mobile work
  • Flexible entering hours
  • 30 working days of holidays
  • Annual Training Plan
  • Mercedes-Benz benefits (Renting plans, employee discount)

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
At Tata Technologies we make product development dreams a reality by designing, engineering and validating the products of tomorrow for the world’s leading manufacturers. Due to our continued growth we are now recruiting for Data Scientist to be based at our customer site in Gothenburg.




Our Digital Enterprise Solutions (DES) Department leverages extensive manufacturing know-how for enlightened enterprise systems. Our deep industry experience allows us to drastically reduce process time and effectively streamline business flows for any organization. Our world-class consultants enable organizations to realize the power of the integrated enterprise by providing superior consulting and implementation services.




Do you love to play with data and want to make a real impact on our electrification journey?

Then you should join our small, but growing, team of Data Scientists at Traction Battery. We offer you a varied work with room to follow exciting threads in the data until the end. We will challenge you and expect you to do the same to bring out the best from each and one of us.




Responsibilities:




You will perform data analyses based on measurement data from test / field /customer vehicles to follow up on battery usage including battery degradation and quality related issues.

The insights will be used to support development of battery systems including design both HW and SW components. An important part of the work is to develop mathematical models for prediction of battery behavior with special focus on battery ageing. You will also define requirements for data collection together with component owners and system architects. Your results will be used by many internal stakeholders within the company including R&D, but also teams working with quality, service, and aftermarket. You will also contribute to an increased usage of data driven development within the company in general and facilitate interactions with the rest of the data community in the company.




Knowledge/skills:




We see that you have a master’s degree in engineering, preferably within Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or similar with a couple of years of relevant experience.

You will need skills in Python and scientific packages like NumPy, Pandas etc. and experience in building data pipelines, data transformation and data visualization.

You share our passion for vehicle electrification and enjoy being part of a team.

Your analytic ability, creativity and interaction with different teams create a great atmosphere for innovative solutions.

You have a conceptual thinking, not afraid of taking vital actions when required.




If you in addition have skills in any of below it is beneficial:

• Version control tools for collaborative development (Git)

• Familiarity with working on modern cloud-based environments

• AI/Machine learning and Databases (SQL) • DevOps tools such as Kubernetes and Docker

• Experience with CI/CD tools such as Tekton and ArgoCD

• BI tools like Power BI or similar.







If you are passionate about bringing innovation to the projects you work on and want to join a global company, then this is the place for you.




Tata Technologies: Engineering a better world.

Show more

Title: Machine Learning Engineer (LLMs)
Description:
At Sinch, we pioneer the way the world communicates. Our customer communications cloud empowers businesses to reach everyone in world, in seconds or less, through mobile messaging, email, voice and video. We reach every phone on the planet 7 times a year and 8 out of 10 largest US tech companies are our customers. Sinch AI adds a layer of intentional intelligence on top of that, to build smarter, safer conversational experiences, faster.

As a Machine Learning (ML) Engineer, you will play a vital role in building and expanding the core machine learning capabilities of Conversational AI at Sinch. Working as part of a dynamic and cross-functional team, you will have the autonomy to define objectives and goals, taking ownership of the entire product development life cycle - from planning and design to implementation, testing, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance.

You will work on the intersection of the Generative AI team and the Conversational AI team of Sinch. The Conversational AI team is responsible for all conversational experiences in Sinch Chatlayer, Sinch Engage, and Sinch MessageMedia. Here, your focus will be on leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) and generative AI to both make bot building much easier and bots themselves much more effective, natural and enjoyable. You will evaluate, test, customize, deploy, and integrate the latest LLMs into the platform to create more advanced and intuitive conversational experiences.

Our tech stack: Python, Kubernetes, GCP, AWS, PyTorch, MLFlow, OpenSearch, LangChain, OpenAI LLMs, Gemini LLMs, Open-Source LLMs like LLama

As a Machine Learning Engineer, Your Responsibilities Will Include


Experimenting with, applying, and benchmarking new algorithms, with a strong emphasis on LLMs and generative AI
Deploying machine learning code in the cloud
Proactively exploring new and emerging (generative) AI solutions that can enhance the value delivered to our product and customers
Contributing your innovative ideas to enable the development of human-like chat and voice bots using the latest advancements in generative AI
Setting up proof-of-concepts and transforming them into production-ready features


Requirements


You are an AI enthusiast who keeps up with the latest trends in AI and ML, and loves to use these new technologies to solve real-world problems
You have worked with machine learning for at least three years and are familiar with common natural language processing and machine learning concepts such as clustering, embeddings, neural networks,...
You have put machine learning applications in production before and are familiar with concepts such as unit testing, CI/CD pipelines and monitoring, but also on how you measure the quality of the machine learning solution
You have built an LLM-based application and are keen to build many more!
You are proficient in Python
You are fluent in English


Benefits

Sinch is a global company composed of people from different countries and cultures. Our benefits adjust regionally to support employees and help them to thrive in every stage of life. We offer valuable benefits and resources, including health and life insurance, a flexible work environment, retirement savings plans, and more.

Our Hiring Process

In Sinch, we are committed to following a recruitment process that is fair, objective, consistent, and equal opportunity. Our Talent Acquisition team, together with hiring managers and the rest of the interviewing team, persistently works towards identifying the people that best fit each open job, based on Sinch' s hiring needs and candidates' career expectations.

We encourage applications from strong candidates with relevant professional backgrounds for this role. Not all applicants will meet all job requirements exactly! Don't let that stop you from considering Sinch for the next step in your career. We are always open to candidates that could bring new insights and perspectives to Sinch!
Show more

Title: Data Scientist (Smart Agriculture)
Description:
Lay the groundwork for tomorrow with Kubota!




Since 1890, Kubota has evolved in a unique way worldwide. With a strong will to solve problems in food, water and the environment, we have leveraged our strength as a manufacturer and a solutions provider. Spanning across 120+ countries and employing more than 50,000 people in Asia, Europe and North America, Kubota generates revenue in excess of $20 billion. From agricultural and industrial machinery, and overall water solutions, to any other living environment solution, our question, and our challenge was always the same: what can we do to meet the demands and enhance our lives for tomorrow? Explore this exciting career opportunity and join us on the journey as we seek to be an “Essentials Innovator for Supporting Life”.




My job, Our future




Kubota Technology Innovation Europe department

The KTI-EU organization is a newly established department focusing on digital solutions and systems development from both a fundamental and applied research perspective. It bridges the gap between the market research, collaborations and technology mapping (driven by our Innovation Center Europe) and the commercial development done by our R&D centers, like Kubota Research and Development Europe and Kverneland Group. The KTI department centers itself on the European market but in strong collaboration with the global organization and other regional offices e.g., KTI-SV (Silicon Valley, USA) to align and coordinate global initiatives.




In this context and in order to strengthen our team, we are looking to recruit a Data Scientist. This activity is related to analyzing agricultural data, developing predictive models and providing actionable insights to drive informed decision-making in the field of smart agriculture. Not only just analyzing the data, but also be responsible for planning and executing field experiments, including how to collect the data (when, where, how often, with which sensor, what). Therefore, in addition to agricultural knowledge, sensors knowledge like RGB, multi/hyper-spectral, thermal, etc is also required. The contribution is broad, including agricultural crop monitoring, machine monitoring, autonomous driving, monitoring of quality of agricultural work while working with tractors and agricultural implements. This is a critical role for the success of our technology advancements pushing the boundaries of productivity and sustainability.




Responsibilities:

Define and design experiments from data collection to evaluation and support actual data collection in fields

Collecting, cleaning, and analyzing agricultural data to identify patterns and trends
Building predictive models to optimize crop yield, field operation and farm management
Utilize statistical analysis and machine learning techniques to derive insights from agricultural data.
Reflect the results of experimental planning and sensing data analysis in the sensor system
Research relevant papers, formulate a hypothesis, and explore the best approach
Technical information collection, reporting, and evaluation of the AI integrated agricultural products, related sensors.
Work within joint research projects with external local and international partners.




Requirements:

Master’s or Ph.D. in data science, agricultural engineering, or a related field
Proficiency in statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization
Experience with agricultural data analysis and understanding of farming practices
Strong programming skills in languages such as Python, R, or similar
Fluent in English
Communication skills for requirement definition or alignment of specs with global stakeholders by documentation, design reviews, etc.




Nice to have:

Experience of mobile sensing data analysis
Experience of sensor development and sensors knowledge such as RGB, multi/hyper-spectral, thermal sensors
Italian, Spanish or French language proficiency
Experience of collaboration with team members from various backgrounds.
Experience in agricultural mechanistic modeling as well as statistical modeling.
Experience with GIS (Geographic Information Systems)

Show more

Title: Junior Data Scientist AI Academy
Description:
Über uns

statworx ist ein führendes Beratungs- und Entwicklungsunternehmen für Daten und KI mit Sitz in Frankfurt am Main. Wir bieten strategische Beratung für mittelständische Unternehmen und globale Konzerne. Wir entwickeln innovative Daten- & KI-Lösungen für alle Unternehmensbereiche und Tätigkeitsfelder. Wir befähigen Menschen auf allen Kompetenzniveaus mit unseren Daten- & KI-Bildungsformaten. Kurz gesagt: Wir unterstützen Unternehmen bei allen Aspekten der digitalen Transformation – seit mehr als 10 Jahren, in über 500 Daten- & KI-Projekten und für über 100 Kunden aus fast allen Industrien.

Seit 2011 haben wir in unserer statworx AI Academy weltweit bereits über 15.000 Personen in den Themengebieten Data Science, künstliche Intelligenz und Machine Learning weitergebildet. Von kleinen Trainingseinheiten & Einstiegsprogrammen bis zu langfristigen und globalen Schulungskonzepten und Data Culture Initiativen für unsere Kunden im DAX-Umfeld, bieten wir ein vielfältiges und maßgeschneidertes Portfolio an. Unser Anspruch ist es, stetig am Puls der Zeit zu sein (aktuell u.A. Generative KI, Large Language Models und Data Culture) und unsere Trainingsmethoden konstant weiterzuentwickeln. Zum weiteren Aufbau unseres Teams und Schulungsangebotes suchen wir derzeit nach Verstärkung.

Deine Aufgaben


Du unterstützt uns bei der Beratung unserer (potenziellen) Kunden aus verschiedenen Industrien hinsichtlich des Einsatzes von Trainings zur Fortbildung ihrer Mitarbeitenden in den Themenfeldern Daten, Machine Learning, AI und Cloud
Du wirkst bei der Entwicklung und Durchführung von spannenden AI Workshops für verschiedene Zielgruppen (Projektmanager:innen und Expert:innen) mit
Du unterstützt bei der Entwicklung von neuen Trainingskonzepten und -inhalten und konzipierst interaktive Aufgaben u.a. für Themenbereiche wie künstliche Intelligenz, Generative KI, Data Science, Machine Learning, Cloud, Business Intelligence und Coding
Du sondierst den Markt für AI und Cloud-Trainings und unterstützt uns dabei, vielversprechende Zukunftsfelder zu identifizieren und so unseren Mitbewerber:innen stets einen Schritt voraus zu sein


Dein Profil


Du hast Dein Masterstudium im Bereich Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, o.ä. erfolgreich abgeschlossen
Im Rahmen Deines Studiums und/oder studentischer Tätigkeiten konntest Du bereits erste theoretische und idealerweise auch praktische Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Statistik, Data Science, Machine Learning, Cloud oder AI sammeln
Weiterhin verfügst Du über gute Kenntnisse in der Programmiersprache Python
Du begeisterst dich sehr für die Themenfelder Digitalisierung, Big Data und AI und hast Freude daran, diese Begeisterung mit anderen zu teilen
Du zeigst herausragende konzeptionelle und analytische Fähigkeiten
Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Sachverhalte strukturiert grafisch und verbal aufzubereiten und an andere Personen zu vermitteln
Du bist kommunikationsstark, verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (mindestens C1, in Wort und Schrift) und fühlst dich wohl, Schulungen in beiden Sprachen zu halten
Du hast Freude daran, gelegentlich Reisen zu unseren Kunden im europäischen Raum zu unternehmen


Das bieten wir Dir


Die Möglichkeit, die Weiterentwicklung unseres Schulungsportfolios aktiv mitzugestalten und mit innovativen Methoden dazu beizutragen, anspruchsvolle und komplexe Themen wie AI und Data Science verständlich und erlebbar zu machen 
Umfassende eigene methodische und persönliche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten inklusive regelmäßiger interner Schulungsangebote sowie eines individuellen Weiterbildungsbudgets
Kreative Zusammenarbeit und kurze Entscheidungswege und -prozesse, gepaart mit einer agilen Arbeitsweise  
Flache, teambasierte Hierarchien und ein freundschaftliches Arbeitsklima
Kurze Entscheidungswege und -prozesse, gepaart mit einer agilen Arbeitsweise und regelmäßigem Feedback
Ein offenes, integratives, chancengleiches Arbeitsumfeld
Faires Gehalt: es erwarten dich transparente Gehaltsstufen, welche wir regelmäßig an Marktentwicklungen anpassen
Eine Arbeitswoche nach dem 4:1-Modell, bei dem wir uns an 4 Tagen pro Woche auf unsere Kerntätigkeiten konzentrieren und 1 Tag pro Woche für unsere individuelle und organisatorische Weiterentwicklung verwenden (z. B. durch Schulungen, teamübergreifende Arbeitsgruppen) 
Ein modernes, hochwertig eingerichtetes Office das zum Austauschen und Verweilen einlädt, sowie die Möglichkeit flexibel auch von anderen Orten zu arbeiten, darunter auch bis zu 6 Wochen aus dem EU-Ausland
Stark ermäßigtes Jobticket Deutschland sowie kostengünstig Zugang zu einer Vielzahl von Sport- und Wellnessangeboten (Wellpass)
Und viele weitere Benefits, wie z. B. Apple IT-Equipment (MacBook Pro), regelmäßige Team-Events, Employee Discounts, Kinderbetreuungsunterstützung, kostenfreie Getränke und Snacks


Deine Bewerbung

Bewirb Dich einfach über das Bewerbungsformular und hänge Deinen aktuellen Lebenslauf an. Wir werden uns anschließend umgehend bei Dir melden. Bei Fragen rund um Deine Bewerbung oder die verschiedenen Einstiegsmöglichkeiten erreichst Du uns telefonisch unter +49-(0)69-6783-0676-5 oder unter jobs@statworx.com.

Was für uns besonders wichtig ist: Wir schätzen die Einzigartigkeit jedes Menschen und begegnen einander stets auf Augenhöhe. Unterschiedliche Hintergründe, Einstellungen und Ideen bereichern uns und bilden die Grundlage unseres Erfolgs. Daher freuen wir uns über jede Bewerbung – unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität.
Show more

Zum weiteren Aufbau unseres Teams und Schulungsangebotes suchen wir derzeit nach Verstärkung.

  • Du unterstützt uns bei der Beratung unserer (potenziellen) Kunden aus verschiedenen Industrien hinsichtlich des Einsatzes von Trainings zur Fortbildung ihrer Mitarbeitenden in den Themenfeldern Daten, Machine Learning, AI und Cloud
  • Du wirkst bei der Entwicklung und Durchführung von spannenden AI Workshops für verschiedene Zielgruppen (Projektmanager:innen und Expert:innen) mit
  • Du unterstützt bei der Entwicklung von neuen Trainingskonzepten und -inhalten und konzipierst interaktive Aufgaben u.a. für Themenbereiche wie künstliche Intelligenz, Generative KI, Data Science, Machine Learning, Cloud, Business Intelligence und Coding
  • Du sondierst den Markt für AI und Cloud-Trainings und unterstützt uns dabei, vielversprechende Zukunftsfelder zu identifizieren und so unseren Mitbewerber:innen stets einen Schritt voraus zu sein

Dein Profil

  • Du hast Dein Masterstudium im Bereich Data Science, Wirtschaftsinformatik, Mathematik, Statistik, Wirtschaftswissenschaften, o.ä. erfolgreich abgeschlossen
  • Im Rahmen Deines Studiums und/oder studentischer Tätigkeiten konntest Du bereits erste theoretische und idealerweise auch praktische Erfahrungen in den Bereichen Statistik, Data Science, Machine Learning, Cloud oder AI sammeln
  • Weiterhin verfügst Du über gute Kenntnisse in der Programmiersprache Python
  • Du begeisterst dich sehr für die Themenfelder Digitalisierung, Big Data und AI und hast Freude daran, diese Begeisterung mit anderen zu teilen
  • Du zeigst herausragende konzeptionelle und analytische Fähigkeiten
  • Dir macht es Spaß, komplexe Sachverhalte strukturiert grafisch und verbal aufzubereiten und an andere Personen zu vermitteln
  • Du bist kommunikationsstark, verfügst über sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (mindestens C1, in Wort und Schrift) und fühlst dich wohl, Schulungen in beiden Sprachen zu halten
  • Du hast Freude daran, gelegentlich Reisen zu unseren Kunden im europäischen Raum zu unternehmen

Das bieten wir Dir

  • Die Möglichkeit, die Weiterentwicklung unseres Schulungsportfolios aktiv mitzugestalten und mit innovativen Methoden dazu beizutragen, anspruchsvolle und komplexe Themen wie AI und Data Science verständlich und erlebbar zu machen 
  • Umfassende eigene methodische und persönliche Weiterentwicklungsmöglichkeiten inklusive regelmäßiger interner Schulungsangebote sowie eines individuellen Weiterbildungsbudgets
  • Kreative Zusammenarbeit und kurze Entscheidungswege und -prozesse, gepaart mit einer agilen Arbeitsweise  
  • Flache, teambasierte Hierarchien und ein freundschaftliches Arbeitsklima
  • Kurze Entscheidungswege und -prozesse, gepaart mit einer agilen Arbeitsweise und regelmäßigem Feedback
  • Ein offenes, integratives, chancengleiches Arbeitsumfeld
  • Faires Gehalt: es erwarten dich transparente Gehaltsstufen, welche wir regelmäßig an Marktentwicklungen anpassen
  • Eine Arbeitswoche nach dem 4:1-Modell, bei dem wir uns an 4 Tagen pro Woche auf unsere Kerntätigkeiten konzentrieren und 1 Tag pro Woche für unsere individuelle und organisatorische Weiterentwicklung verwenden (z. B. durch Schulungen, teamübergreifende Arbeitsgruppen) 
  • Ein modernes, hochwertig eingerichtetes Office das zum Austauschen und Verweilen einlädt, sowie die Möglichkeit flexibel auch von anderen Orten zu arbeiten, darunter auch bis zu 6 Wochen aus dem EU-Ausland
  • Stark ermäßigtes Jobticket Deutschland sowie kostengünstig Zugang zu einer Vielzahl von Sport- und Wellnessangeboten (Wellpass)
  • Und viele weitere Benefits, wie z. B. Apple IT-Equipment (MacBook Pro), regelmäßige Team-Events, Employee Discounts, Kinderbetreuungsunterstützung, kostenfreie Getränke und Snacks

Deine Bewerbung

Bewirb Dich einfach über das Bewerbungsformular und hänge Deinen aktuellen Lebenslauf an. Wir werden uns anschließend umgehend bei Dir melden. Bei Fragen rund um Deine Bewerbung oder die verschiedenen Einstiegsmöglichkeiten erreichst Du uns telefonisch unter +49-(0)69-6783-0676-5 oder unter jobs@statworx.com.

Was für uns besonders wichtig ist: Wir schätzen die Einzigartigkeit jedes Menschen und begegnen einander stets auf Augenhöhe. Unterschiedliche Hintergründe, Einstellungen und Ideen bereichern uns und bilden die Grundlage unseres Erfolgs. Daher freuen wir uns über jede Bewerbung – unabhängig von Geschlecht, Nationalität, ethnischer und sozialer Herkunft, Religion, Weltanschauung, Behinderung, Alter sowie sexueller Orientierung und Identität.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Are you a brilliant new graduate, passionate about Big Data and Machine Learning? Do you think Artificial Intelligence is changing the world with groundbreaking innovation? Dive into Deep Learning algorithms and cutting-edge techniques to develop human-machine interaction.

Join Reply!




WHAT WE OFFER

A technological nirvana. At Reply, true innovation runs in our blood. We have a nerdy heart and we are proud of it. Cool tech stack, guaranteed hands-on experience, challenges, hackathons, table footballs and free coffee are already waiting for you.
A continuous learning experience. In Reply, what you know is never enough. Choose from internal webinars, learn from other Replyers and teach others what keeps you awake at night.
A structured career. The perfect path to your achievements. Now with a brand new Graduate Programme.




WHAT WE NEED

Academic background. With a brilliant Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or technical equivalent.
Teamwork mindset. In Reply, we believe in teamwork. Once here, your team will be your family and will guide you everywhere. We hope you will love it.
Curiosity and drive. We ask you to love what you do. And to always aim for excellence.




WHO WE ARE

Reply is a company that specialises in Consulting, Systems Integration and Digital Services with a focus on the conception, design and implementation of solutions based on the new communication channels and digital media. Reply partners with key industrial groups in defining and developing business models made possible by the new technological and communication paradigms such as Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud Computing, Digital Communication, the Internet of Things and Mobile and Social Networking.

Feel interested?

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
¿Te apasionan los retos? Izertis es tu empresa.




Buscamos una persona para desarrollar proyectos de inteligencia artificial generativa que se incorpore al equipo de tecnologías emergentes de Izertis en el desarrollo de proyectos de I+D, productos propios y para nuestros clientes.

En el equipo de tecnologías emergentes desarrollamos productos y proyectos digitales innovadores de calidad con un fuerte componente de innovación en un entorno cambiante.

Estamos trabajando en proyectos para clientes del sector financiero y estamos buscando un perfil de Data Scientist para proyectos de gran envergadura.

Nuestro objetivo es acompañar a nuestros clientes a explorar, evaluar e implementar estrategias de asistentes conversacionales diferenciales.




Responsabilidades




Extracción de datos en diferentes entornos tecnológico de cliente (KOA, Datapool, Host, Devo)
Generación de visualización en Google Cloud Platform partiendo de visualizaciones en Qlik y Excel.
Definición e identificación de variables de aprendizaje, generación de nuevos conjuntos, realización de transformaciones y limpieza.
Creación de modelos basados en inteligencia artificial que puedan entrenarse y desplegarse en plataforma Google Cloud Platform.
Experiencia de ámbito tecnológico;
DataNow (GCloud)
BigQuery
Vertex
DBT
NoteBooks
Programación Python (pandas, numpy, matplotlib, scikit-learn) o R
QLIK
Es valorable experiencia sobre pipelines de IA (SageMaker, Azure ML, Vertex AI).




Competencias




Proactividad y buena comunicación para contribuir a que cada vez trabajemos mejor
Amor por el trabajo preciso y detallado en la manipulación y análisis de datos
Capacidad para trabajar en colaboración en un equipo multidisciplinar (Diseño+UI/UX+Backend+IA…)




¿Qué ofrecemos?




Salario competitivo establecido por acuerdo en función de experiencia/conocimientos.
Acceso al plan de retribución flexible de la empresa.
Posibilidad de teletrabajo y flexibilidad horaria.
Trabajo en un ambiente distendido, de confianza, responsabilidad y compañerismo.
Trabajo en un entorno dinámico y en proyectos estables de diferentes sectores.




¿Quienes Somos?




Izertis con 25 años de experiencia, incluida en el índice IBEX Growth Market 15 y entre las 1.000 empresas que más rápido crecen entre los países europeos, te da la oportunidad de desarrollar tu carrera profesional junto a más de 1.800 emplead@s a través de sus oficinas distribuidas por Europa, América y África y con presencia en más de 50 países donde prestamos servicios y proyectos a través de su amplio portfolio de soluciones tales como: IA, Data & Intelligence, Digital Experience, Devops, Cloud, Cyber Security, Smart Software Labs, Quality Assurance, Hyper Automation, It Sourcing, Business Solutions, Blockchain, Project & IT Governance Consulting y otras tecnologías habilitadoras de los procesos de transformación.




Trabaja con contrato indefinido desde el primer día, en una compañía tecnológica puntera, con presencia en más de 50 países del mundo.

Fórmate desde el primer día, te permitiría desarrollar tu carrera profesional de una manera más clara y podrás especializarte aún más en eso que te apasiona.




Benefíciate de un plan de retribución flexible a gestionar de manera individual entre los siguientes servicios: seguro médico, guardería, ayuda a comida, transporte público.

Disfruta flexibilidad horaria, de jornada intensiva los meses de Julio y agosto, y los viernes de todo el año, además de todos los viernes del año, 22 días de vacaciones + día del cumpleaños + 24 y 31 de diciembre.




https://www.izertis.com/en/talent

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vlGdnXPRFf4




Lidera tu Desarrollo Profesional y súmate al reto que Izertis te ofrece.

¡Te esperamos!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist Junior
Description:
Niuma, società ICT leader in Italia per la realizzazione di soluzioni di eProcurement con all'attivo un portfolio di aziende Clienti d'interesse internazionale, con sede a Milano e Roma, e centro di Ricerca e Sviluppo a Bari per tecnologie di ultima generazione con integrazione di soluzioni di Intelligenza Artificiale e Blockchain, ricerca il seguente profilo da impiegare presso un suo importante Cliente:




Data Scientist Junior – Ambito AI




Responsabilità:

Collaborare con il team di data science per sviluppare modelli predittivi e soluzioni AI che supportino le esigenze aziendali.
Analizzare grandi quantità di dati strutturati e non strutturati per identificare pattern e tendenze significative.
Supportare il processo di pulizia, trasformazione e validazione dei dati.
Implementare e testare algoritmi di machine learning, deep learning e altre tecniche avanzate di AI.
Contribuire alla creazione di report e visualizzazioni per comunicare i risultati ai team interni e agli stakeholders.




Requisiti:

Precedente esperienza nel ruolo di almeno 1 anno.
Laurea in Matematica, Statistica, Informatica, Ingegneria o in un campo correlato.
Conoscenza di base dei principali linguaggi di programmazione per la data science (Python, R).
Comprensione dei principi di machine learning e intelligenza artificiale.
Esperienza con strumenti di data analysis e visualizzazione (es. Pandas, Matplotlib, Seaborn).
Conoscenza di base di SQL per l’interrogazione dei database.
Capacità di problem-solving e attitudine analitica.
Buone capacità comunicative e predisposizione al lavoro in team.
Conoscenza Lingua Inglese B2
Conoscenza Lingua Italiana C2/Madrelingua




Nice to have

Esperienza con framework di machine learning come TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn.
Conoscenza di tecniche di deep learning e NLP (Natural Language Processing).
Esperienza di lavoro in ambienti cloud (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure).
Conoscenza di Big Data e strumenti correlati (es. Hadoop, Spark).




Offerta economica / inquadramento:

Il contratto sarà di apprendistato.

Il livello e la retribuzione saranno definiti in base all'esperienza del candidato in fase di colloquio.




Area di lavoro: Milano

Modalità di lavoro: Ibrida

___

Rispondendo al presente annuncio, la società Niuma srl, Titolare del Trattamento, otterrà i Suoi dati definiti dal GDPR (regolamento UE 2016/679) "dati personali". L'informativa estesa ai sensi dell'art. 13 del GDPR è reperibile sul sito internet all'indirizzo https://www.niuma.it/pdf/Informativa_CV.pdf , alla quale si fa espresso richiamo, intendendosi qui come espressamente trascritta e riportata. Si specifica in ogni caso: (A). I dati sono trattati e conservati in relazione a finalità connesse ad esigenze di recruiting e contrattuali e verranno trattati per la durata delle attività di recruiting, anche non inerenti il presente annuncio. La base giuridica del trattamento è la volontà del candidato di sostenere un colloquio professionale. Il consenso al trattamento è condizione necessaria per le finalità sopra descritte. Pertanto, il trattamento non potrà essere effettuato senza il consenso dell'interessato. (B) La nostra società effettua operazioni di trattamento sui dati anagrafici su supporti informatici e cartacei; i dati personali saranno trattati internamente alla società titolare del trattamento e non ceduti a terzi; (C) In qualità di interessato, il candidato è titolare dei diritti di cui all'art. 15 del GDPR, che potranno essere esercitati mettendosi in contatto con Niuma S.r.l. all'indirizzo privacy-policy@niuma.it

Show more

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

  • Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
  • Experience with text summarization and/or text generation

Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Who are we:




Neotalent Conclusion is one of the leading Iberian specialists providing services in Information Technology and Engineering services. As part of the Netherlands-based organization Conclusion, which has an ecosystem of over 25 companies and 3,600 employees, we are focused on increasing the technological capacity of our clients and the digital transformation of their application ecosystems.

We are talent specialists, attracting the best people and combining them with the needs of the most ambitious projects, at the right time. Our success comes from our investments in innovation, our focus on results, and, above all, the guarantee that our people will have happy and rewarding careers.

With over 25 years of solid experience, Neotalent Conclusion has established its presence in key locations, including Lisbon, Porto, and Madrid. The company currently has more than 950 professionals in the different areas in which it operates.

Neotalent, the responsive people.




Find out more about us at www.neotalent.pt.




Role Overview:




We are looking for a Data Scientist to integrate one of our largest international partners in the telecommunications sector. It is one of the biggest references in the area, with a significant presence in more than 6 countries.




What you will do:




As a Data Scientist, you will collect, interpret, and publish data that will help to make business decisions in a specific time frame to determine how successful those decisions can be.




What you are like:




• Degree in an analytical field (e.g. Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, Management Science);

• 2+ years experience as a Data Scientist or in a role closely related to data (e.g. Analytics);

• 2+ years of scripting with one of these languages (PHP, R, PYTHON);

• Experience with packages such as NumPy, SciPy, pandas, scikit-learn, dplyr, ggplot2.







Why join us:




• Work on challenging projects for big clients

• Learn more about emerging technologies

• Possibility of working remotely

• Design your career plan

• Access to continuous training and certifications

• Evolve through our internal mobility program

• … and much more!

Show more

Title: Data Scientist Intern
Description:
Data Scientist Intern




Alkemy è una società internazionale specializzata nell’evoluzione del modello di business di grandi e medie aziende e una public company quotata sul mercato MTA STAR di Borsa Italiana.

La nostra mission è di migliorare la posizione di mercato e la competitività delle grandi e medie aziende stimolando l’evoluzione del modello di business in coerenza con l’innovazione tecnologica e i comportamenti dei consumatori. Grazie a un team di oltre 1000 persone, integriamo competenze nelle aree di Strategy, Communication, Design, Performance, Technology, Insights & Analytics con un’offerta, pensata per il contesto post-digital, che copre l’intera catena del valore dalla strategia all’implementazione.




IL RUOLO




Per il potenziamento dell’area di Data & Analytics (former Nunatac SpA), Alkemy è alla ricerca di un Neolaureati e Laureandi da inserire come Data Scientist Intern. La Mission di questa area è di accompagnare le aziende nel loro percorso di crescita, aiutandole a fondare la propria strategia sui dati e sulla conoscenza che da essi deriva. È composta da Data Scientists e Data Engineers che formano un team dinamico, informale e rigoroso al lavoro su applicazioni di Advanced Analytics innovative e di valore.

Lavorare nell’area Data & Analytics significa affrontare tutte le sfide legate all'uso di metodi quantitativi, dalle tecniche statistiche consolidate agli approcci pionieristici di Machine Learning e Deep Learning applicati ai Big Data, per ottenere un impatto reale sul business dei nostri clienti. Siamo in continua crescita e cerchiamo nuove persone che sappiano combinare le competenze tecniche con la visione, l'intraprendenza e la passione per i dati.




Sede di lavoro: Milano

Esperienza: Neolaureati o laureandi (meno di 6 mesi dalla prova finale)

Area: Data & Analytics




REQUISITI NECESSARI




Laurea in ambito scientifico (statistica, matematica, fisica, economia. informatica)
Forte interesse in ambito gestione ed analisi dei dati, data visualization, advanced analytics, machine/deep learning
Curiosità e proattività
Ottima capacità di lavorare in gruppo
Buona conoscenza della lingua inglese




NICE TO HAVE




Conoscenza, anche base, del mondo SAS, R e Python




Stage retribuito finalizzato all'inserimento in Azienda.




COSA OFFRIAMO




In Alkemy ci impegniamo costantemente nel creare le migliori condizioni affinché tutte le nostre persone sentano di poter esprimere al meglio il proprio valore ed il proprio talento - e possano sentire Alkemy come casa propria - indipendentemente da genere, età, nazionalità, orientamento sessuale e religioso.

Siamo da sempre profondamente convinti che un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo che valorizzi tutte le diversità sia non solo un imperativo valoriale, ma un fattore critico di successo per il nostro business. Aggreghiamo sotto lo stesso tetto persone con professionalità e background molto diversi e da sempre promuoviamo una cultura di condivisione e crescita continua.

Eccellenza, Passione, Integrità e Concretezza sono i valori fondanti di Alkemy, che tutti noi condividiamo e che ci guidano nel realizzare la nostra mission. I valori Alkemy definiscono la nostra identità e sono alla base della nostra cultura organizzativa, indirizzano i nostri comportamenti nei confronti di tutte le nostre persone e dei nostri clienti, costruendo evolutivamente il nostro approccio al business.

I profili ritenuti in linea verranno contattati entro 20 giorni. Non saranno valutate candidature sprovviste di cv completo allegato. I dati dei candidati verranno trattati ai sensi dell’Informativa Privacy sempre consultabile sul nostro sito.alkemy.com

Show more

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Are you passionate about both data science and (strategic) consulting? Do you like to create insights and turn them into action to create lasting impact? We are searching for an experienced Data Scientist for our Data & AI team to support our clients by combining business sense with data modelling. If this description fits your profile, we are looking for you!

The Data & AI team at IG&H is using the latest data and AI technology to help our clients innovate. To do so, our team of 25 data experts works closely together with our Technology and Sector teams. Through smart collaboration, we have delivered over 40 (Gen)AI projects in the last two years for our clients in Retail, Healthcare and Financial Services. As a Data Scientist, you will play a central role in truly understanding our client’s needs, translating this into value, creating solutions, developing Gen(AI) models and turning them into action. We believe it is key to have business sense as well as broad experience with data related topics (analytics, artificial intelligence, etc.) to create real business value. On top of that, you need to be able to communicate clearly and convincingly. Not only for effective project execution, but also to inspire (internal) stakeholders on the latest trends and developments in the field of Data and AI.

You will typically work in multidisciplinary project teams for one project at a time. Although being able to deliver work independently is appreciated, involvement of a project manager and technical experts ensures high-quality delivery and facilitates you to maintain a steep learning curve. We believe in diverse teams and diverse profiles in our Data & AI team. Some of our Data Scientists develop to be great consultants with technical knowledge and execution power, while others focus more on gaining deep technical expertise to deliver value from there. Working on a different range of projects in different sectors, you’ll be able to find your own sweet spot.

In addition, we believe that a caring and fun working environment will help you to dare to step out of your comfort zone and learn. We offer continuous learning through the IG&H Academy, in which you will get trainings to boost your data science, consulting and people skills. Also, you will be assigned a mentor, who will be there for you to provide you with guidance.

Above all, people are at the heart of what we do. This of course comes back in the work we deliver for our clients (why make a data product if the people who need to use it do not understand or want to use it?). At the same time, a fun working culture is key for who we are. With an inspiring office in Utrecht where we can connect, have abundant parties, team activities and sport events (both organized for the entire IG&H organization as well as specifically for the Data & Analytics team), IG&H is truly a Great Place To Work. And yes, we are certified!

Working for the Data & AI Team at IG&H Consulting is incredibly diverse, and fun at the same time. It’s been a great place to develop my technical know-how, management consulting skills and commercial effectivity. The team is young and ambitious, with a strong desire to solve complex puzzles, develop personally & professionally and do fun activities together. All in all, IG&H has been a great place to work for over 6 years already!

Lars van Kempen – Manager Data & AI

What you bring:

2+ years of relevant working experience at (among others) management consultancy firms, other professional services firms, and/or corporate data & AI teams
Python skills
Analytical, inventive and practical
A passion for Data & AI and the capability to translate business needs into impactful solutions
Drive to work in a fast-changing and high-demand, innovative environment
MSc degree, preferably in a technical field: e.g. Data Science, Computer Science, Physics, Engineering, Econometrics
You have excellent oral and written communication skills in Dutch and English

What we offer:

An opportunity to help clients to transform to become data-driven and make an impact through data & analytics
Working at a Great Place to Work with a pleasant atmosphere, enthusiastic colleagues who support you, where we put people first and encourage new initiatives
Working with exciting new (disruptive) technologies and international teams
Smart collaboration with talented consultants who will constructively challenge you
Company car / good mobility scheme
Permanent contract
The possibility to work parttime (32 hours), at least 4 days a week
25 holiday days with the possibility to take up five more
The possibility to take a sabbatical after 3 years of employment
IG&H facilitates a ‘"Health Human” program, where you get guidance with all adjustments in life after having a child
Generous bonus scheme
And more, which we would love to elaborate on

WHY IG&H?

IG&H is transforming leading companies across the Health, Retail and Finance sectors.

Together with our world-class technology partners, we help our clients move forward and stay relevant. With insightful advice, great design and unrivalled digital platforms. Our exceptional results come from successfully aligning people, business and technology.

With over 300 talented colleagues on board, people who genuinely embrace change and challenges, we’ve created a unique high-daring, high-caring culture. Attracting extraordinary people and inspiring them to push the boundaries for themselves and our clients.

If this vacancy is right for you, then this is a great place to work, with super happy employees and clients. We’re still just embarking on this exciting adventure. Why not be part of it?

We’re truly committed to diversifying our workforce and actively encourage women to apply for this role!

Moreover, we want our employees to reflect the diversity of society. We work together with a remarkable mix of talents, personalities and cultures. IG&H is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to national origin, race, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, genetics, disability or age. We care about individuality, but most importantly, we share the pride of our collective achievements and a Great Place to Work.

  • Working at a Great Place to Work with a pleasant atmosphere, enthusiastic colleagues who support you, where we put people first and encourage new initiatives

  • Smart collaboration with talented consultants who will constructively challenge you
  • Company car / good mobility scheme
  • Permanent contract
  • The possibility to work parttime (32 hours), at least 4 days a week
  • 25 holiday days with the possibility to take up five more
  • The possibility to take a sabbatical after 3 years of employment
  • IG&H facilitates a ‘"Health Human” program, where you get guidance with all adjustments in life after having a child
  • Generous bonus scheme
  • And more, which we would love to elaborate on

WHY IG&H?

IG&H is transforming leading companies across the Health, Retail and Finance sectors.

Together with our world-class technology partners, we help our clients move forward and stay relevant. With insightful advice, great design and unrivalled digital platforms. Our exceptional results come from successfully aligning people, business and technology.

With over 300 talented colleagues on board, people who genuinely embrace change and challenges, we’ve created a unique high-daring, high-caring culture. Attracting extraordinary people and inspiring them to push the boundaries for themselves and our clients.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Machine Learning Engineer for a project based in Lisbon.


Requirements:

  • Masters Degree in computer science or equivalent;
  • Experience in training and deploying neural networks and have practical hands-on experience with deep learning frameworks like PyTorch and Tensorflow;
  • Experience in backend and API development with Python (FastAPI, Flask);
  • Excellent knowledge of and practical experience with Object Oriented Programming, design patterns, algorithms and data structures, version control systems (e.g. Git);
  • Experience with cloud platforms (e.g. Azure) and Docker;
  • Kubernetes is a plus;
  • Fluent English (mandatory).


If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English to catarina.sa@decskill.com with reference “CS/Machine_Learning”.


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
Data Scientist




Capgemini en quelques mots

Choisir Capgemini, c'est choisir une entreprise où vous serez en mesure de façonner votre carrière selon vos aspirations, où vous serez soutenu et inspiré par une communauté d’experts dans le monde entier, où vous pourrez réécrire votre futur. Rejoignez-nous pour redéfinir les limites de ce qui est possible, contribuer à libérer la valeur de la technologie pour les plus grandes organisations et participez à la construction d’un monde plus durable et inclusif.




Vos missions

En tant que Lead Technique Data Science au sein de la practice Insights & Data, vous serez amener à intervenir sur des projets data pour :




Idéaliser les cas d’usages et cadrer le projet afin de répondre aux exigences métiers à partir de solutions innovantes d’Intelligence Artificielle
Promouvoir les bonnes pratiques au sein de l’équipe avec le développement d’une méthodologie de travail et d’amélioration continue appropriés
Participer aux propositions commerciales sur la partie Data
Construire une relation de confiance avec le client en tant qu’interlocuteur privilégié et assurer la qualité des rendus finaux ainsi que le développement de nouveaux enjeux business
Faire parti des leaders de la communauté Data Science et influencer sur la stratégie Data d’Insights & Data
Continuer de vous former sur tous les aspects de votre métier et assurer une veille technologique sur les innovations les plus pertinentes à mettre en place




Votre profil

De formation Bac + 5 en école d’ingénieur ou équivalent universitaire avec une spécialisation Data Science
A partir de 6 ans d’expériences
Compréhension fine des enjeux business et pilotage d'une équipe
Connaissance de plusieurs langages de programmation (Python, Scala, Spark…) et Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure, OVH)
Le Machine Learning, le NLP et le Deep Learning n’ont plus de secret pour vous
Bon niveau d'anglais







3 raisons de nous rejoindre

Qualité de vie au travail : accord de télétravail en France et à l’international, accord sur l’égalité professionnelle, la parentalité, l’équilibre des temps et la mobilité durable.
Apprentissage en continu : certifications et formations en libre accès, accompagnement sur mesure avec votre carreer manager, parcours d’intégration sur 9 mois.
Avantages groupe & CSE : plan actionnariat, activités à tarifs préférentiels, remboursement partiel vacances, remboursement de votre abonnement sportif ou culturel




Nos engagements et priorités

Le groupe Capgemini encourage une culture inclusive dans un cadre multiculturel et handi-accueillant. En nous rejoignant, vous intégrez un collectif qui valorise la diversité, développe le potentiel de ses talents, s’engage dans des initiatives solidaires avec ses partenaires, et se mobilise pour réduire son impact environnemental sur tous ses sites et auprès de ses clients.




Capgemini est un leader mondial, responsable et multiculturel, regroupant près de 350 000 personnes dans plus de 50 pays. Fort de 55 ans d’expérience, nous sommes un partenaire stratégique des entreprises pour la transformation de leurs activités en tirant profit de toute la puissance de la technologie et des innovations dans les domaines en perpétuelle évolution tels que le cloud, la data, l’Intelligence Artificielle, la connectivité, les logiciels, l’ingénierie digitale ou les plateformes.




Get The Future You Want* | www.capgemini.com/fr-fr

*Capgemini, le futur que vous voulez

  • Compréhension fine des enjeux business et pilotage d'une équipe
  • Connaissance de plusieurs langages de programmation (Python, Scala, Spark…) et Cloud (AWS, GCP, Azure, OVH)
  • Le Machine Learning, le NLP et le Deep Learning n’ont plus de secret pour vous
  • Bon niveau d'anglais



3 raisons de nous rejoindre

  • Qualité de vie au travail : accord de télétravail en France et à l’international, accord sur l’égalité professionnelle, la parentalité, l’équilibre des temps et la mobilité durable.
  • Apprentissage en continu : certifications et formations en libre accès, accompagnement sur mesure avec votre carreer manager, parcours d’intégration sur 9 mois.
  • Avantages groupe & CSE : plan actionnariat, activités à tarifs préférentiels, remboursement partiel vacances, remboursement de votre abonnement sportif ou culturel


Nos engagements et priorités

Le groupe Capgemini encourage une culture inclusive dans un cadre multiculturel et handi-accueillant. En nous rejoignant, vous intégrez un collectif qui valorise la diversité, développe le potentiel de ses talents, s’engage dans des initiatives solidaires avec ses partenaires, et se mobilise pour réduire son impact environnemental sur tous ses sites et auprès de ses clients.


Capgemini est un leader mondial, responsable et multiculturel, regroupant près de 350 000 personnes dans plus de 50 pays. Fort de 55 ans d’expérience, nous sommes un partenaire stratégique des entreprises pour la transformation de leurs activités en tirant profit de toute la puissance de la technologie et des innovations dans les domaines en perpétuelle évolution tels que le cloud, la data, l’Intelligence Artificielle, la connectivité, les logiciels, l’ingénierie digitale ou les plateformes.


Get The Future You Want* | www.capgemini.com/fr-fr

*Capgemini, le futur que vous voulez

Title: Data Scientist
Description:
About the job

Astek Polska We are part of the international ASTEK Group, which has been gathering experience in the global IT outsourcing and engineering services market for more than 30 years. The Astek Group is a global player in engineering and technology consulting, present on five continents. What do we draw from the other Group entities in our daily work? First and foremost: inspiration, objectives, good practices, innovative activities and values. In 2020, 2021, 2022 and 2023 we received the Great Place to Work certificate, and thus found ourselves among the fifteen Best Workplaces in Poland in the category: large companies.




Global CMC is undergoing a significant Digital Transformation where standard Business workflows are moving from paper based to digital. Experimental data is becoming more readily available, and our organization need to continue to automate activities using Code-based analytics in order to improve our efficiency, remove low value added tasks and leverage out Digital environment

The objective is to develop code-based analytics, typically Applications (Apps’) in RShiny and Python, that will automate low-value added tasks across Global CMC functions. The Data Science is developing advanced analytics workflow to analyze CMC data and require dedicated skillset to build robust Apps’ that can be distributed to end users to run advanced analytics workflow automatically. The supplier must have the expertise in full stack development and programing is required to package the automated functions developed by data scientists.

Deliverables expected:

Expand RShiny Apps’ for CMC providing Resources simulation across different sites in the CMC perimeters (new applications delivered to support functions in Global CMC)
Develop new Apps’ to predict and simulate plant capacity in the CMC network (new applications delivered to scientists in Global CMC)
Develop new applications in RShiny to support BioProcess Drug Product activities, predicting particle charges on monoclonal antibodies (new application to be used by scientists in CMC)

Full stack service provider support will enable rapid translation of advanced analytics workflow to be packaged in robust and reliable Apps’ that can be distributed to Global CMC employees. In turn the portfolio of Apps developed will increase employee’s efficiency by removing non-value or repetitive tasks in their day-to-day activities. Apps’ will also provide easier access to complex advanced analytics models enabling scientists in Global CMC to generate novel information/insight on their lab experiments.

R, RShiny, Python, GitLab, Machine Learning




Bonus!!! Recommend a friend in our recommendation system and get a bonus of up to PLN 7,000!!! Link: https://astek.pl/system-rekomendacji/

Title: Applied Data Scientist
Description:
Microsoft’s Health and Life Sciences team is dedicated to empowering healthcare organizations ton achieve their goals and improve patient care. We aim to create an efficient and connected healthcare ecosystem by bringing the healthcare ecosystem together which empowers everyone across the healthcare journey to collaborate, communicate, and innovate together to provide better experiences for their workforces and patients or members alike.

Our team has an exciting opportunity for an Applied Data Scientist to expand our Dragon Ambient eXperience (DAX) product to international markets. DAX listens to doctor/patient conversations and

writes highly accurate clinical summaries of the encounter for review by the physician. DAX is an industry leading solution in the US healthcare market, and we are expanding our languages and market to include Germany and France.

#hlsp #dax-intl

Responsibilities

Responsibilities include:


Demonstrate broad understanding of state-of-the-art in machine learning concepts and applications.
Collaborate directly with product leaders, researchers, and engineers within Microsoft Health and Life Sciences division.
Develop state-of-the-art clinical summarization technology using advanced LLM capabilities in multiple languages.
Identifies approaches, and applies, improves, or creates a research-backed solution (e.g., novel, data driven, scalable, extendable) to positively impact DAX international summarization.
Applies language expertise and knowledge of clinical documentation to create high-quality clinical summaries for European markets.
Performs data analysis by reviewing criteria that reflect quality and technical constraints. Reviews data for inclusion in model training, taking actions to address data quality problems.


Qualifications

Required/Minimum Qualifications


Doctorate in relevant field OR equivalent experience
Demonstrated research or applied science experience in Natural Language Processing
Proven experience with LLM technologies and generative AI
Language fluency in English AND French or German, or Dutch


Other Requirements

Ability to meet Microsoft, customer and/or government security screening requirements are required for this role. These requirements include, but are not limited to the following specialized security screenings: Microsoft Cloud Background Check:


This position will be required to pass the Microsoft Cloud background check upon hire/transfer and every two years thereafter.


Preferred/Additional Qualifications


Experience in medical text analytics and/or clinical information retrieval
Experience with text summarization and/or text generation


Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. Consistent with applicable law, all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, citizenship, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, immigration status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran or military status, race, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable local laws, regulations and ordinances. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application process, read more about requesting accommodations.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer
HTML:
Cognizant Romania is home to 2300+ creative technologists and is one of Eastern Europe's largest Software Product Engineering delivery networks. We serve global clients in several industries, including Banking & Financial Services, Insurance, Healthcare & Life Sciences, Communication Media & Technology, and Retail & MLEU (manufacturing, logistics, energy & utilities).

Cognizant Romania was established in 2018 when Cognizant acquired Softvision, a company founded in the late 1990s in Cluj-Napoca, Romania. We continue to build on our history as the preferred engineering partner for thriving Silicon Valley tech companies, now as a prominent Cognizant next generation studio.


We are looking for exceptional ML Engineers, to work with our cross-functional team and join our world-class community of talented experts in Romania.


For this position you should be able to check the following:

  • Knowledge of both traditional ML and Deep Learning techniques;
  • Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts (regression, properties of distributions, statistical tests, etc.) and experience with applications;
  • Experience with ML frameworks: TensorFlow/Keras, PyTorch, JAX, etc;
  • Strong problem-solving skills with an emphasis on product development;
  • Coding knowledge and experience with at least two of the following programming languages: Python, C++, Java, JavaScript, etc;
  • A drive to learn new technologies and algorithms;
  • Good English communication skills.

Nice to have:

  • Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Hadoop, Spark, etc.;
  • Experience with Cloud ML platforms like AWS SageMaker, Azure ML Studio, or GCP;
  • Experience with or knowledge of recent advancements in the field like Transformer architectures, Attention modules, few-shot learning, etc.;
  • Experience with model interpretability, model deployment, and monitoring.

A day in the life of a Machine Learning Engineer:

  • Assess the effectiveness of new data sources and data-gathering techniques;
  • Real-world data is messy and dirty so prepare yourself to clean it, working with labeling teams or developing methods that programmatically label data;
  • Go through research papers for possible solutions and be creative in developing custom models and algorithms to apply to datasets;
  • Develop testing tools to monitor and analyze model performance and data accuracy.
  • Be part of a team of professionals who love collaborative work;
  • Keep up with the latest state-of-the-art ML algorithms;
  • Transfer and receive knowledge throughout our community.


Cognizant Romania Employee Benefits:

  • Flexible Work Schedule - Outside of main work hours, you can create a schedule that suits your needs
  • Hybrid workplace - Whether you like to work from home or go to the office, the choice is yours
  • Annual Vacation Days - 26 days to relax, explore and spend time with loved ones
  • Trainings, workshops, and certifications, unlimited Udemy subscription and more
  • Private medical package
  • Meal tickets
  • Referral bonuses
  • Life insurance
  • Banking services
  • Bookster


Please note that only suitable candidates will be contacted and that by applying to this role you are being informed about your personal data being processed by Cognizant.

You can find more details here: https://www.cognizant.com/us/en/privacy-notice

Title: Junior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
About The Company

We build the company around people so we're looking for teammates who want to build something big with us, too!

Our international team of more than 500 professionals is spread across the United States, Europe, Latin America, Australia, and India. But we're all connected by our innovative thinking, and desire to create as one team. Our clients are from industries like healthcare, data engineering, warehouse automation, retail digitalisation, mobile app development, and e-commerce. As our projects are so varied, we value teammates who have fresh perspectives and unique experiences. For us, what makes you different makes you right for our team.

Find your place on our team!

The project and your role


Assist in the development and testing of machine learning models under the guidance of senior engineers.
Prepare and clean data for model training.
Conduct basic data analysis and create reports.
Test and validate machine learning models.
Support the deployment and monitoring of models in a production environment.
Participate in discussions and development of new machine learning solutions.



Your skills


Bachelors degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or related fields (or final year of study).
Basic knowledge of machine learning algorithms and their applications.
Experience with Machine Learning Frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, scikit-learn (including academic projects).
Proficiency in Programming Languages such as Python, R, or others used in machine learning.
Experience with Data Manipulation and Analysis Tools (e.g., pandas, NumPy).
Ability to quickly learn and adapt to new technologies and tools.
Strong teamwork and communication skills.
Problem-solving ability and analytical thinking.



Nice to have


Internships or academic projects in machine learning.
Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) for developing and deploying models.
Basic knowledge of working with big data and related tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark).
Participation in open-source projects or scientific conferences.



What we can offer


Our modern stack projects are the right mix of exciting and challenging
Gain access to our diverse range of training programs, courses, and certifications;
Choose your work style - remote, on-site or hybrid in one of our stunning offices. We offer the freedom of flexible working hours.
Enhance your language skills with our corporate English classes
Work from anywhere and explore the world with our Workation program
